Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Dochteur> what if I use BTCH and HUSH in lite mode in Agama 0.3.6b? Does it affect only native coins?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> @Dochteur, move your funds ASAP.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Dochteur> ok thx for help but what about BTCH there? Is there any other wallet option?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Pixelised> Whatever new address you have control over, you can send btch from your Agama wallet to the new address. But I could be wrong, maybe wait for someone more experienced from the Hush team to answer that question.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Dochteur> it is bound to my HUSH WIF so could they be send to the same adress?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Dochteur> if I sent it from Agama in lite mode, can I send a little at first to test it and then the whole amount? Will it generate new adress for all unspent coins or something?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> both, btch and hush3 are working in 0.3.6b lite mode

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> @Dochteur lite mode uses only one address, change addresses only occur in native-mode

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> Do not generate a new address/seed with Agama 0.3.x - your funds will be at risk

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> Use Verus-agama

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Dochteur> HUSH is not in Verus agama I imported hush wallet to Hushmate and trasfer it to a newly generated wallet but after first test transaction now I want to move it and get bad-txns oversize error

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Dochteur> I need to do it as fast as possible to make it safe and dont know what to do

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> yes, verus-agama does not have all the asset-chains, all you need is the new address, check your balance using hush3 explorer

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <penguin> if you are referring to hush and not hush3 then you will need to follow the import-guide for claiming onto the new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I had to write my own scripts to tell my modem how to connect to my particular ISP in the late 90's, PPP scripts for those that are old

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this was a huge barrier to entry for people using an ISP vs AOL back then

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> only because I was a Linux sysadmin was it "easy" for me

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> now that barrier doesn't exist anymore, it's completely gone

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @赖红光 I think we are still in the very early stages of cryptocoins, where people have to do low-level things to do simple things

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it will not be like this forever

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <JWolf (WW Clan leader)> Good perspective, I hope your right.
